explanation: Agent A is correct. In metal_irq_register_controller the variable node is only used for read-only traversal and comparison (metal_list_for_each(&irq_cntrs, node) and node == &cntr->node) — the function does not modify the list elements through node. According to MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 a pointer should be const-qualified whenever possible, so node could and should be declared as const struct metal_list *node. (The same pattern appears in metal_irq_allocate.) If the list-iteration macro or other APIs require a non-const pointer, the proper remedy is to adapt the list API/macros to support const iteration or to use a non-modifying const-qualified iterator; otherwise the non-const declaration is a MISRA 8.13 violation.
